detailed_description: A Python tool inspired by Knitr for generating reproducible reports from Markdown files containing Python code, executing the code and embedding results.

name: bookdownplus
one_line_profile: Extensions and templates for R bookdown
detailed_description: An R package that simplifies the use of 'bookdown' for writing varied types of books and scientific documents by providing templates and helper functions.

name: mindr
one_line_profile: Markdown to mindmap converter for research structuring
detailed_description: An R package that converts markdown files (.md, .Rmd) into mindmaps, aiding researchers in structuring and visualizing the outline of scientific reports and papers.

name: closeread
one_line_profile: Scrollytelling extension for Quarto
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that enables 'scrollytelling' features, allowing for interactive and engaging presentation of scientific narratives and data visualizations.

name: Quarto CLI
one_line_profile: Scientific and technical publishing system
detailed_description: An open-source scientific and technical publishing system built on Pandoc. It enables the creation of dynamic content with Python, R, Julia, and Observable, supporting reproducible reports, presentations, websites, and books.

name: quarto-r
one_line_profile: R interface for Quarto
detailed_description: The R package interface to the Quarto CLI, allowing R users to render Quarto documents and projects directly from R/RStudio.

name: quarto-ext/shinylive
one_line_profile: Quarto extension to embed serverless Shiny for Python applications via WebAssembly
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that allows embedding Shinylive applications directly into Quarto documents. It enables the creation of interactive, serverless scientific dashboards and reports that run entirely in the user's browser using Pyodide.

name: ymlthis
one_line_profile: R package to write and manage YAML front matter for R Markdown
detailed_description: An R library designed to assist in writing and managing YAML front matter for R Markdown, bookdown, blogdown, and other reproducible research document formats. It streamlines the configuration of scientific reports.

name: quarto-drop
one_line_profile: Quarto extension for interactive R/Python consoles in slides
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that provides a drop-down interactive console (R or Python) and code editor for Quarto presentations. It utilizes WebAssembly to run code in the browser, enhancing scientific communication and pedagogy.

name: quarto-live
one_line_profile: WebAssembly powered interactive code blocks for Quarto
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that enables interactive code blocks and exercises for R (via WebR) and Python (via Pyodide) in Quarto documents. It allows for reproducible, client-side execution of scientific code within reports.

name: jupyter-zeppelin
one_line_profile: Converter from Zeppelin notes to Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: A utility script to convert Apache Zeppelin notebooks into Jupyter notebooks. It facilitates the migration and interoperability of scientific data analysis workflows between these two popular platforms.

name: garage
one_line_profile: Toolkit for reproducible reinforcement learning research
detailed_description: A toolkit for developing and evaluating reinforcement learning algorithms. It focuses on reproducibility and provides a collection of high-quality implementations of RL algorithms and environments for scientific research in AI.

name: bookdown
one_line_profile: Authoring framework for reproducible technical books and documents with R Markdown
detailed_description: An open-source R package that facilitates writing books and long-form technical reports with R Markdown. It supports dynamic code execution, cross-references, and multiple output formats (HTML, PDF, ePub), serving as a standard engine for reproducible scientific authorship.

name: rmarkdown
one_line_profile: Dynamic document generation engine for R
detailed_description: A core tool in the R ecosystem for creating dynamic, reproducible documents. It combines code, results (plots, tables), and prose into a single output, supporting dozens of static and dynamic output formats. It is the foundational engine for scientific reporting in R.

name: rticles
one_line_profile: LaTeX journal article templates for R Markdown
detailed_description: A package providing a suite of custom LaTeX templates for various scientific journals and publishers. It enables researchers to write articles in R Markdown and automatically format them to meet specific submission requirements of journals like IEEE, ACM, Elsevier, etc.

name: CoCalc
one_line_profile: Collaborative calculation platform for scientific research and teaching
detailed_description: A web-based cloud computing platform that provides a collaborative environment for SageMath, Jupyter Notebooks, R, LaTeX, and other scientific tools. It supports real-time collaboration on research projects and data analysis.

name: mkdocs-gallery
one_line_profile: Automatic example gallery generator for scientific documentation
detailed_description: A plugin for MkDocs that generates a gallery of examples from Python scripts. It executes the scripts, captures their output (including plots and figures), and embeds them into the documentation. This is widely used for creating reproducible documentation for scientific libraries.

name: strid
one_line_profile: String diagram generator for LaTeX
detailed_description: A tool for generating LaTeX code for string diagrams, which are used in category theory, quantum physics, and logic. It allows users to describe the diagram structure and compiles it into high-quality TikZ/LaTeX visualizations.

name: nbsphinx
one_line_profile: Sphinx source parser for Jupyter notebooks enabling reproducible research reports
detailed_description: A Sphinx extension that provides a source parser for Jupyter notebooks, allowing them to be included in Sphinx documentation. This is critical for generating reproducible scientific reports and documentation sites directly from computational notebooks.

name: Sphinx
one_line_profile: Comprehensive documentation and report generation engine for Python
detailed_description: The standard documentation generator for the Python ecosystem, widely used in scientific computing (e.g., SciPy, NumPy) to generate technical documentation and reports. It supports LaTeX math rendering, code execution, and various output formats (HTML, PDF, LaTeX).

name: Sphinx-Gallery
one_line_profile: Automatic example gallery generator for scientific Python libraries
detailed_description: A Sphinx extension that builds an HTML version of Python scripts, capturing outputs (plots, logs) and structuring them into a gallery. It is a standard tool for creating reproducible examples and tutorials in scientific Python packages.

name: Spyder Reports
one_line_profile: Literate programming and report generation plugin for Spyder IDE
detailed_description: A plugin for the Spyder scientific IDE that allows rendering Markdown reports using Pweave as a backend. It enables scientists to generate reports directly within their analysis environment.

name: bayesplot
one_line_profile: Plotting library for Bayesian models and MCMC diagnostics
detailed_description: An R package providing a library of plotting functions for posterior analysis, MCMC diagnostics, and posterior predictive checking, designed to work with the Stan probabilistic programming ecosystem.

name: HELM
one_line_profile: Holistic Evaluation of Language Models framework
detailed_description: A framework for the holistic, reproducible, and transparent evaluation of foundation models (LLMs). It provides a standardized way to analyze model performance across various metrics, generating detailed reports and visualizations essential for AI research.

name: rfsoc_qpsk
one_line_profile: QPSK transceiver overlay for RFSoC PYNQ
detailed_description: A PYNQ overlay that implements a QPSK (Quadrature Phase Shift Keying) transceiver on Xilinx RFSoC hardware. It serves as a software-defined instrument for signal generation and analysis in radio frequency engineering.

name: rfsoc_sam
one_line_profile: Spectrum Analyser Module for RFSoC PYNQ
detailed_description: An open-source spectrum analyzer implementation for Xilinx RFSoC devices using the PYNQ framework. It provides interactive visualization and analysis of radio frequency spectrums.

name: literate-calc-mode
one_line_profile: Literate programming mode for Emacs Calc
detailed_description: An Emacs mode that enables literate programming for the Emacs Calculator. It allows users to write documents where calculations are embedded and executed, facilitating reproducible calculation reports.

name: surveydown
one_line_profile: Markdown-based programmable survey generation using R and Quarto
detailed_description: A tool for designing and deploying surveys using Markdown, R, and Quarto. It allows researchers to create reproducible, programmable data collection instruments integrated with the scientific R ecosystem.

name: nb_pdf_template
one_line_profile: LaTeX template for accurate Jupyter Notebook to PDF conversion
detailed_description: A template for nbconvert that improves the PDF output of Jupyter Notebooks, ensuring that scientific reports generated from notebooks are properly formatted and readable.

name: papyrus
one_line_profile: Literate programming tool for Common Lisp and Markdown/Org-mode
detailed_description: A tool that enables literate programming by combining Common Lisp with Markdown or Org-mode. It facilitates the creation of executable documentation and reports for Lisp-based scientific workflows.

name: ttnn-visualizer
one_line_profile: Visualization tool for Tenstorrent AI model execution and tensors
detailed_description: A comprehensive tool for visualizing and analyzing the execution of AI models on Tenstorrent hardware. It provides interactive graphs, memory plots, and tensor details, aiding in the analysis and optimization of scientific AI models.

name: present
one_line_profile: Script interpolation engine for Markdown documents
detailed_description: A tool that executes code blocks within Markdown documents and interpolates the output back into the document. It serves as a language-agnostic engine for literate programming and reproducible report generation.

name: jupyterlab-nbconvert-nocode
one_line_profile: JupyterLab extension to export notebooks to PDF/HTML without code cells
detailed_description: A helper library and JupyterLab extension that provides NBConvert exporters for generating clean reports (PDF/HTML) from Jupyter notebooks by automatically stripping out code cells, facilitating scientific reporting and communication.

name: notestar
one_line_profile: Reproducible notebook system based on R targets package
detailed_description: A notebook system for R that integrates with the 'targets' pipeline package, enabling researchers to create reproducible laboratory notes and reports where dependencies and computations are managed automatically.

name: jupyterlab_powerpoint
one_line_profile: Convert Jupyter Notebooks to PowerPoint presentations
detailed_description: A JupyterLab extension that allows users to generate Microsoft PowerPoint presentations directly from Jupyter Notebooks, streamlining the process of creating scientific presentations from data analysis code.

name: paperboy
one_line_profile: Web frontend for scheduling and distributing Jupyter notebook reports
detailed_description: A production-grade application for scheduling, executing, and distributing Jupyter Notebooks as reports. It allows users to parameterize notebooks and run them on a schedule, generating reports for scientific or data analysis monitoring.

name: open-data-scientist
one_line_profile: AI agent for automated data analysis and report generation
detailed_description: An AI-driven data scientist agent utilizing the ReAct framework to automate complex data analysis tasks. It can execute Python code, process datasets, and generate detailed analytical reports, serving as an assistant for scientific data exploration.

name: nbrun
one_line_profile: Tool to automate execution of Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: A utility to automate the execution of Jupyter Notebooks from within other notebooks or scripts, facilitating the creation of chained analysis workflows and reproducible scientific pipelines.

name: LibKGE
one_line_profile: Knowledge graph embedding library for reproducible research
detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for training, evaluating, and analyzing knowledge graph embeddings (KGE). It emphasizes reproducibility and hyperparameter optimization, widely used in scientific knowledge representation and link prediction tasks.

name: lab.note
one_line_profile: R Markdown templates for laboratory notes and reports
detailed_description: An R package providing templates and utilities for creating structured laboratory notes and research reports using R Markdown, designed to support documentation in scientific workflows.

name: sos-papermill
one_line_profile: Batch executor for SoS (Script of Scripts) notebooks
detailed_description: An extension of the Papermill tool designed for SoS (Script of Scripts) notebooks, enabling the parameterized execution and batch processing of polyglot scientific notebooks (supporting multiple languages like Python, R, Julia in one file).

name: xaringan
one_line_profile: R package for creating reproducible HTML5 presentations
detailed_description: An R package that provides an R Markdown extension based on remark.js to create HTML5 presentations. It enables researchers to embed R code, execution results, and scientific visualizations directly into slides, supporting the workflow of reproducible research and scientific communication.
